items.title: A sacred pipe returns to Whitecap Dakota First Nation after 135 years
items.description: More Indigenous communities across Canada are reuniting with items that were taken or given away generations ago. The Vatican and the Canadian Catholic Church are reportedly working on an agreement to return about 100,000 Indigenous items Catholic missions sent to Rome in the 1920s.

items.title: Manitoba Government Receives Report on Future of Technology, Innovation and Productivity
Police Presence at Health Sciences Centre 24-7 to Protect Health-Care Workers and Patients
Weekend transit shutdown cancelled in Montreal as union, STM reach tentative deal
items.description: The public transit strike which would have shut down bus and Metro service in Montreal for the weekend has been cancelled after a last-minute tentative deal was reached Friday night.

items.title: Photos: Electronic powerhouses Kaytranada and Justice co-headline Rogers Arena
items.description: The DJ and the French duo combined for a memorable show.

items.title: Montreal bus and metro strike averted after last-minute tentative deal
items.description: A last-minute tentative deal between the STM and its drivers’ union has averted a planned weekend strike, meaning regular bus and metro service will continue.
